ecksdee.shapes

Class Circle

  • java.lang.Object
    • ecksdee.shapes.Shape
      • ecksdee.shapes.Circle

  • public class Circle
extends Shape
    makes a representation of a cricle on a surface
    Author:
    Johnry

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class ecksdee.shapes.Shape

        x, y

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Circle()
      Creates a default instance of a Cricle object with all dimensions set to zero.
      Circle(double x, double y, double diameter)
      Creates a new instance of a Circle object with the center at x + diameter/2 and y + diameter/2, with a radius of diameter/2
      Circle(int x1, int y1, double Diameter, java.awt.Color stroke, java.awt.Color fill, int width)
      makes a very customized Circle

      allows user to resize circle, with the center in the same spot.

      translates a circle x pixels right, and y units down

      • Circle

        public Circle()
        Creates a default instance of a Cricle object with all dimensions set to zero.

      • Circle

        public Circle(double x,
              double y,
              double diameter)
        Creates a new instance of a Circle object with the center at x + diameter/2 and y + diameter/2, with a radius of diameter/2
        Parameters:
        x - x coord of center
        y - y coord of center
        diameter - diameter of circle

      • Circle

        public Circle(int x1,
              int y1,
              double Diameter,
              java.awt.Color stroke,
              java.awt.Color fill,
              int width)
        makes a very customized Circle
        Parameters:
        x1 - center x coord
        y1 - center y coord
        Diameter - Diameter of Circle
        stroke - stroke color of type java.awt.Color
        fill - fill color of type java.awt.Color
        width - strokeWeight of object

      • translate

        public void translate(double x,
                      double y)
        translates a circle x pixels right, and y units down
        Parameters:
        x - amount to move right (negative value for move left)
        y - amount to move down (negative for move up)

      • scale

        public void scale(double scaleFactor)
        allows user to resize circle, with the center in the same spot.
        Parameters:
        scaleFactor - multiplies the diameter by the scale factor.

        Overrides:

        Parameters:
